Divine Descent.quote: "The journey begins with a descent into the shadows of existence." (Dante's Inferno)

Sacred Crisis.quote: "In the middle of the journey of our life, I found myself in a dark wood." (Dante)

Holy Recognition.quote: "And we shall see how serious things are really laughable, and what seems laughable is really serious." (Plato)

Divine Reversal.quote: "The last shall be first, and the first last." (Matthew 20:16)

Cosmic Perspective.quote: "From the height of cosmic consciousness, all is divine play." (Sri Aurobindo)

Sacred Detachment.quote: "Learn to laugh at yourself, and you will never cease to be entertained." (Zen teaching)

Divine Lightening.quote: "The burden becomes light when carried with laughter." (Sufi saying)

Mystical Inversion.quote: "The fool who persists in his folly will become wise." (William Blake)

Holy Transformation.quote: "When the heart weeps for what it has lost, the spirit laughs for what it has found." (Sufi proverb)

Sacred Integration.quote: "To play with the infinite is to invite the infinite to play with you." (Alan Watts)

Divine Liberation.quote: "When you realize how perfect everything is, you will tilt your head back and laugh at the sky." (Buddha)

Cosmic Release.quote: "Let go of seriousness, and the sacred reveals itself in play." (Taoist teaching)

Holy Transcendence.quote: "Beyond tragedy and comedy lies the divine smile." (Sri Ramakrishna)

Sacred Return.quote: "Coming full circle, the sage laughs at what the seeker took seriously." (Zen saying)

Divine Embodiment.quote: "To embody the cosmic joke is to become the divine comedian." (Joseph Campbell)

Mystical Service.quote: "The enlightened one returns to the marketplace with gift-bestowing hands." (Zen Ten Ox-herding Pictures)

Cosmic Celebration.quote: "The whole universe is a divine celebration, and we are all invited to the party." (Rumi)

Sacred Performance.quote: "Life is not a tragedy but a divine comedy, play your part well." (Vedantic teaching)

Divine Radiation.quote: "The sage's laughter spreads joy like ripples on a pond." (Chinese proverb)

Eternal Play.quote: "In the eternal now, all is divine play unfolding." (Meister Eckhart)

Journey of the Soul.quote: "Midway upon the journey of our life, I found myself within a forest dark, for the straightforward pathway had been lost." (Inferno 1:1-3)

Structure of the Afterlife.quote: "Through me you pass into the city of woe, through me you pass into eternal pain." (Inferno 3:1-2)

Sin and Punishment.quote: "Abandon all hope, ye who enter here." (Inferno 3:9)

Redemption and Purification.quote: "To run o'er better waters now hoists sail the little bark of my wit." (Purgatorio 1:1-2)

Divine Justice.quote: "Justice moved my high maker; divine omnipotence created me." (Inferno 3:4-5)

Love and Free Will.quote: "The Love which moves the sun and the other stars." (Paradiso 33:145)

Guidance and Wisdom.quote: "I think and judge it best you follow me, and I shall be your guide." (Inferno 1:112-113)

The Three Realms.quote: "I saw within Its depth how It conceives all things in a single volume bound by Love." (Paradiso 33:85-86)

Symbolism of Light.quote: "The glory of Him who moves all things penetrates the universe, resplendent in one region more, elsewhere less." (Paradiso 1:1-3)

Contrapasso.quote: "As they sinned, so are they punished here." (Inferno 28:142)

The Dark Wood.quote: "How harsh and bitter it is to tread the thoughts of others' stairs!" (Paradiso 22:58-59)

The Empyrean.quote: "But already my desire and will were being turned like a wheel, all at one speed, by the Love that moves the heavens." (Paradiso 33:143-145)

Human Frailty.quote: "I did not die, and yet I lost life's breath." (Inferno 5:141)

Divine Grace.quote: "Here force failed my high fantasy; but already my desire and will were rolled—even as a wheel that moveth equally—by the Love that moves the sun and the other stars." (Paradiso 33:142-145)

The Final Vision.quote: "In that abyss I saw how love held bound into one volume all the leaves dispersed through the universe." (Paradiso 33:85-87)

The Role of Beatrice.quote: "Gaze fixed upon me, like one who would speak, she then began: 'Look well! I am, I am indeed Beatrice.'" (Purgatorio 30:73-75)

The Role of Virgil.quote: "Take thou thine own way; I elect thee and crown thee as lord over thyself." (Purgatorio 27:142)

Descent into Hell.quote: "Into the hidden things let us descend." (Inferno 4:114)

Ascent to Paradise.quote: "I mounted to the circle of the first stair, which, though of marble, was so polished and smooth that in it I mirrored me." (Purgatorio 9:94-96)

Divine Mystery.quote: "O grace abounding, wherein I presumed to fix my look on the Eternal Light so deep that in it I discerned all things." (Paradiso 33:82-84)
